Metadata: An antibacterial pigment from the sponge "Dendrilla membranosa"

Recently, the authors reported the antimicrobial properties of an extract from "Dendrilla membranosa", a bright yellow Antarctic sponge which may be immune to predation by nudibranchs and seastars due to the presence of defensive chemicals. The antimicrobial component was identified as 4,5,8-​trihydroxyquino​line-​2-​carboxylic acid by interpretation of spectral data and confirmed by synthesis.
